physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A+Ox3. In no acute distress. Tanned, not jaundiced. Sclerae anicteric. Oropharynx clear. Regular rate and rhythm; normal S1/S2 without murmurs, clicks, or rubs. Moderate tenderness in the bilateral lower left quadrant greater than the right lower quadrant with localized peritonitis. Abdomen soft, mildly distended. No edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressively worsened clinical picture over six to eight hours leading to tachycardia and requirement for intubation.
